question: [File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_single_with_default_params()] [Storage directory reuse] Can storage_dir be reused across multiple runs without cleanup causing state pollution between benchmark executions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: test_compare_prod_and_another()] [Executor comparison bypass] Can differences between AptosVMBlockExecutor and alternative executors be exploited to hide malicious state changes in one implementation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: test_compare_prod_and_another()] [Genesis key reuse] Does each test properly isolate genesis_key usage, or can key reuse across tests cause cross-contamination of test states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: test_compare_prod_and_another()] [Transaction replay] Can the same transaction be executed on multiple executors causing unintended side effects or state divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: test_compare_prod_and_another()] [Block ID collision] Can HashValue::random() generate duplicate block_ids causing block execution conflicts? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: test_compare_prod_and_another()] [Abort/discard check bypass] Does check_aborts_discards_retries at lines 1046, 1066 properly validate all failure modes, or can some transaction failures go undetected? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: test_compare_prod_and_another()] [WriteSet comparison vulnerability] Can differences in write_set encoding between executors mask actual state manipulation attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: test_compare_prod_and_another()] [Event type mismatch] At lines 1081-1093, can event types match but event data differ in ways that indicate security vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: test_compare_prod_and_another()] [Resource group validation] At lines 1116-1139, can resource group comparison miss subtle differences in resource ordering or encoding that affect semantics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: test_compare_prod_and_another()] [Value matching bypass] When values_match is false, can critical security differences be ignored leading to accepting unsafe executor implementations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: assert_equal_transaction_outputs()] [Gas measurement manipulation] Can gas_used() calculations differ between executors in ways that allow DoS or economic attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: assert_equal_transaction_outputs()] [Status code bypass] Can transaction status differ between executors but both appear successful, masking execution failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: assert_equal_transaction_outputs()] [Auxiliary data manipulation] Can auxiliary_data contain security-relevant information that differs between executors without failing equality checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: test_generic_benchmark()] [TempPath cleanup failure] Can TempPath temporary directories fail to cleanup after tests, accumulating disk usage and eventually exhausting storage? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: test_generic_benchmark()] [Transaction type materialization] Can TransactionTypeArg.materialize() produce malformed transactions that bypass validation checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Function: test_generic_benchmark()] [Workload progress manipulation] Can WorkflowProgress::MoveByPhases be manipulated to skip critical initialization steps? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Global: Pipeline coordination] Can pipeline stages (generation, execution, commit) get desynchronized causing transactions to be executed out of order or dropped? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Global: BlockExecutor state] Can BlockExecutor be reused across benchmark runs without proper state reset, causing state leakage between runs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Global: DbReaderWriter consistency] Can DbReaderWriter reads return stale data while writes are in progress, causing TOCTOU vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Global: VM global state] Can global VM settings (shards, concurrency, blockstm version) be modified by concurrent benchmark executions causing interference? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Global: Transaction ordering] Can transaction reordering during parallel generation violate sequence number requirements or create dependency violations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Global: Memory pressure] Can large-scale benchmarks exhaust available memory without proper backpressure mechanisms, causing OOM kills? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Global: Checkpoint consistency] Can checkpoint operations be interrupted leaving partial checkpoints that cause corruption when reused? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Global: Feature flag conflicts] Can incompatible feature flags be enabled simultaneously causing undefined behavior in transaction execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/lib.rs] [Global: Atomic state transitions] Are state transitions properly atomic, or can partial updates be visible during concurrent access causing inconsistent views? (Critical)
